decks.notes: This aggro deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with instants and sorceries to bring back Arclight Phoenix multiple times in a single turn, overwhelming the opponent with a flurry of flying attacks. The deck's strategy revolves around efficient card draw, discard effects, and cheap spells to enable the recursive nature of Arclight Phoenix and to maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Thing in the Ice and Brazen Borrower to control the board and protect your Phoenixes, ensuring a fast-paced and aggressive playstyle.

The deck focuses on using a variety of powerful spells and versatile creatures to control the game and out-value the opponent. By ramping into Niv-Mizzet Reborn with cards like Sylvan Caryatid and Bring to Light, the deck aims to generate card advantage and answer threats with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Abrupt Decay. The deck also includes versatile removal options like Slaughter Games and Anguished Unmaking to deal with a variety of threats. Additionally, the deck includes some ramp and fixing with cards like Gilded Goose and Fabled Passage to ensure consistent mana production.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion, Gutterbones, and Bloodsoaked Champion. It also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and removal spells like Fatal Push to control the board. The deck has a strong synergy with cards like Scrapheap Scrounger and Castle Locthwain, providing both resilience and card advantage. With a solid mana base and a mix of creatures, removal, and disruption, this Mono Black Aggro deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain control throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a board of small, efficient creatures and using them to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Knight of the White Orchid to pump up the team and generate value, the deck aims to push through damage consistently and efficiently. The inclusion of Stasis Snare and Elspeth Conquers Death provides some removal options to clear the way for attacks. With a mix of creatures and support spells, this deck aims to be fast, aggressive, and resilient in the face of opposing strategies.

The main concept of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to be highly aggressive and put pressure on the opponent early in the game. The deck includes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board while utilizing powerful creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Rankle, Master of Pranks to deal damage quickly. The deck also includes graveyard recursion with cards like Scrapheap Scrounger and Dread Wanderer to maintain a steady stream of threats. Overall, the key strategy is to swarm the opponent with creatures and disrupt their game plan while dealing consistent damage.

The main concept of this deck is to use artifacts and artifact creatures to quickly apply pressure on the opponent, while also having the ability to protect your threats with counterspells and removal spells. The deck aims to utilize Ensoul Artifact and Skilled Animator to turn small artifacts into powerful threats, while also leveraging the explosive potential of Shrapnel Blast. The use of cards like Ghostfire Blade and Stonecoil Serpent allows for flexible gameplay and the ability to adapt to different board states. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements like Stubborn Denial and Hope of Ghirapur to control the game tempo.

This Spirit Aggro deck focuses on swarming the battlefield with low-cost, flying creatures like Spectral Sailor, Mausoleum Wanderer, and Empyrean Eagle, while providing disruption with cards like Spell Queller and Nebelgast Herald. The deck also features protection and pump effects from Supreme Phantom and Selfless Spirit to maintain a strong board presence. Mutavault is included for additional creature support, while the mana base is optimized for consistent white and blue mana sources. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly with a fast and aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on using powerful control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also generating card advantage and value through graveyard recursion and land ramp. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's resources and threats, along with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to generate constant value, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and win the game through attrition. The deck also utilizes key creatures like Ishkanah, Grafwidow and Emrakul, the Promised End to close out games efficiently.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards using powerful spells like Dig Through Time and Thoughtseize, and then utilize the combo between Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to win the game instantly by manipulating the library. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Fatal Push and Thought Erasure to control the opponent's board and hand. With Jace, Wielder of Mysteries as a backup win condition, this deck aims to combo off quickly and efficiently to secure victory.

This Pioneer 1 vs 1 Spirit Aggro deck focuses on building a strong board presence quickly with efficient and evasive Spirit creatures like Empyrean Eagle and Nebelgast Herald. The deck uses disruptive cards like Spell Queller and Selfless Spirit to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's plays. Collected Company is a powerful card advantage engine that can help refill the board with Spirits. By leveraging the flying and tribal synergies of the deck, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless stream of aggressive creatures.

The deck focuses on using cards like Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to manipulate the library and win the game by either decking out the opponent or having zero cards in the library. The deck also includes a mix of disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the game until the combo can be assembled. It also contains card draw and filtering to help find the combo pieces quickly and efficiently. The strategy revolves around setting up the combo pieces and protecting them until the win condition is achieved.

The central strategy of this deck focuses on quickly getting your library down to just a few cards and then winning the game by either playing Jace, Wielder of Mysteries or Thassa's Oracle. To achieve this, the deck uses cards like Inverter of Truth and Dig Through Time to manipulate the library, along with control elements like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to efficiently draw through the library while protecting its key combo pieces and disrupting the opponent's plans.

The main concept of this Dimir Inverter deck is to utilize powerful combo pieces like Inverter of Truth, Thassa's Oracle, and Jace, Wielder of Mysteries to win the game by manipulating the library and graveyard. The deck focuses on controlling the game with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Drown in the Loch, while also digging through the deck with cards like Dig Through Time and Chart a Course. By effectively utilizing these cards and the graveyard synergy provided by cards like The Scarab God, the deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and win the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of casting Inverter of Truth to invert your library and then casting Thassa's Oracle to win the game by having zero cards left in your library. The deck includes a lot of card draw and disruption spells to help find the pieces of the combo while also disrupting your opponent's plans. Jace, Wielder of Mysteries is another win condition in case Thassa's Oracle is unavailable. The mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the combo pieces.

This deck focuses on efficiently controlling the game through disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while also utilizing filtering cards like Opt and Dig Through Time to set up the combo of casting Inverter of Truth to flip the library upside down, followed by playing Thassa's Oracle to win the game. The deck aims to manipulate the graveyard and hand size to ensure that the combo can be executed successfully, while also maintaining card advantage and board control.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy centered around Spirit creatures. Utilizing cards like Collected Company and Supreme Phantom to quickly build a board presence, while also using cards like Spell Queller and Nebelgast Herald to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of flyers like Empyrean Eagle and Spectral Sailor allows for evasion and additional damage. This deck aims to apply pressure early and consistently to secure victory before the opponent can stabilize.
